title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 877.2 - Definitions and conditions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 877.2 - Definitions and conditions

State Regulations
(a) Item number. In table I an item number is assigned to each
specifically designated waters or portions thereof. (b) Waters index number
as
appearing in table I shall mean that number or abbreviation which has been
assigned to any specifically designated waters or portions thereof for the
purpose of identification. (c) Name
as appearing in table I shall mean the name by which the
specifically designated waters are generally known and which name may appear on
the reference maps. (d) Description. The column headed Description contains designations or
sections of waters under consideration to which a particular assignment of a
class and standards shall apply. (e) Map Ref. No. as
appearing in table I means map reference number and indicates one or more of
the following numbered maps reproduced herein completely, or in part, on which
the specifically designated waters and their index numbers are shown. The
following maps were produced from original maps which may be procured through
the Washington Distribution Section, Geological Survey. Map Ref. No. Name of
quadrangle

Published by

Edition
36

Oriskany
U.S. Geological Survey
1947
39

Rome
U.S. Geological Survey
1947
(f) Class
as appearing in
table I, and denoted by the letter C opposite each specifically designated
waters shall mean class C, as set forth in Part 701, supra. (g) Standards
as appearing in table I, as the letter C opposite
each specifically designated waters shall mean the standards of quality and
purity established for class C, as set forth in Part 701, supra. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
877.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
